benchmark_details.name: Robusto-1 Dataset: Comparing Humans and VLMs on real out-of-distribution Autonomous Driving VQA from Peru
benchmark_details.overview: The Robusto-1 dataset is designed to evaluate the cognitive alignment between humans and Vision-Language Models (VLMs) in autonomous driving scenarios through Visual Question Answering (VQA). It uses dashcam video data from Peru to explore how well these models generalize to out-of-distribution situations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To compare the cognitive alignment of humans and VLMs in driving contexts through a new dataset that features real-world traffic scenarios in Peru.

data.source: Dashcam video data collected from two vehicles in Peru, annotated with questions for VQA.
data.size: 200 five-second video segments sampled from 285 videos
data.annotation: Manual annotation and question formulation by the authors based on metadata derived from video content.

methods: Quantitative analysis of responses through Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA)
Visual Question Answering tasks administered to both humans and VLMs.
metrics: Cognitive alignment score based on similarity of responses
methodology.calculation: Measured the similarity of responses between humans and VLMs using Pearson correlation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher similarity scores indicate better cognitive alignment between humans and VLMs.
methodology.validation: Performance compared to responses from both human participants and multiple VLMs.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of participant demographics for understanding variability in responses across different backgrounds.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Participants provided digital consent, and data was anonymized.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Digital consent was obtained from participant volunteers for their data usage.
